description: From Late Latin chemicus, chimicus, chymicus.

entries.meaning: (archaic) Practising chemistry (or, earlier, alchemy); pertaining to these sciences.

examples: a chymic treasure / Is glittering Youth, which I have spent betimes— / My heart in passion, and my head on rhymes.

entries.meaning: (now rare) A chemist or (earlier) an alchemist.
examples: like the Chymicks masculine equall fire, / Which in the Lymbecks warme wombe doth inspire / Into th'earths worthlesse part a soule of gold  […]

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A solution of chloride of lime, used in bleaching.

verbs.description: chemic (third-person singular simple present chemics, present participle chemicking, simple past and past participle chemicked)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To bleach with a solution of chloride of lime.
